Key Match Events: Brandon Ingram scored 30 points in the game.
Zion Williamson scored 31 points in the game.
Golden State's reserves had a significant impact, with Lindy Waters and Jonathan Kuminga contributing 21 and 17 points, respectively.
Golden State's reserves enjoyed a 42-14 points advantage over the first three quarters.
Golden State won the game with a final score of 124-106.
Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans aimed to finish .500 on their road trip in the back-to-back games at Golden State.
The Pelicans' trio of CJ McCollum, Brandon Ingram, and Jordan Hawkins were noted for their strong three-point shooting starts this season.
Post-Match Reflections: The absence of Steph Curry due to injury was noted, with Buddy Hield and Andrew Wiggins stepping up in scoring roles.
